intro: Moraea debilis, commonly known as the slender moraea, is a species of flowering plant in the Iridaceae family. It is native to South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, often with a distinctive yellow or green stripe. It is typically found in mountainous regions and has adapted to grow in full sun to partial shade. Moraea debilis is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer.
